page.title: 07WYNDLEY CENTRE SUTTON B'HAM
page.content: WYNDLEY LEISURE CENTRE OPENED IN 1974. IT CONSISTS OF TWO MAIN BUILDINGS SPLIT BY AN ATHLETICS FIELD. ONE BUILDING HAS TWO SPORTS HALLS,A PRACTICE HALL,SQUASH COURTS, GYMNASIUM, CHILDRENS PLAYROOM, RESTAURANT, BAR, SHOP, CHANGING ROOMS AND A SAUNA. THE OTHER BUILDING HOUSES THE CAFE AND SWIMMING POOL. A RUNNING TRACK AND FOOTBALL PITCH, BOTH ALL WHEATHER ONES, WERE ADDED IN 1984. THE CENTRE IS VERY POPULAR ESPECIALLY WITH THE 20-25 AGE GROUP. FEW PEOPLE OVER 35 USE THE CENTRE ALTHOUGH GROUPS OF SCHOOL CHILDREN USE THE SWIMMING POOL, SQUASH AND BADMINTON COURTS EXTENSIVELY. THEY COMPRISE 20% OF ITS 900,000 USERS IN 1984. THIS FIGURE SHOWS HOW POPULAR THE CENTRE IS DESPITE THE HIGH CHARGES IMPOSED. 70 STAFF, 32 FULLTIME, ORGANISE OR TEACH THE VERY MANY DIFFERENT SPORTS.
